timeline.bodyText:
Nit: Drop the exclamation mark.
But my larger question is why we are offline here. Is this because we kick off going online only after this API call finishes (like we discussed before)?
timeline.author: schmidt-sebastian

replies.bodyText: That is a mistake, this test should never be offline.
replies.author: IanWyszynski

timeline.author: schmidt-sebastian

timeline.bodyText:
If calling .get() works for these tests, this could be as simple as
ref.setValue(42).get() followed by ref.get().get().
timeline.author: schmidt-sebastian

timeline.bodyText: Please drop exclamation mark as this is user facing. Maybe make this "Client is offline".

timeline.bodyText: Did you consider using ReadFuture to simplify this setup?
timeline.author: schmidt-sebastian

replies.bodyText: After talking offline, this is not possible since we need to run line 3489 and 3490.
replies.author: schmidt-sebastian

timeline.bodyText: Our implementation should also go online without this write. Right now, this test throws "Client is offline" without the previous write. We need to wait until the client goes online and then return the result.
timeline.author: schmidt-sebastian

timeline.bodyText:
Please also add a test that shows the the value is still cached even when there are no remaining listeners. The SDK should keep up to 10 MB of least recently used data. For this to work, you have to track the query via the persistence manager. See here: 
  
    
      firebase-android-sdk/firebase-database/src/main/java/com/google/firebase/database/core/SyncTree.java
    
    
         Line 505
      in
      d920962
    
    
    
    

        
          
           persistenceManager.setQueryActive(query);
timeline.author: schmidt-sebastian

timeline.bodyText: I think this catch can be removed.
timeline.author: schmidt-sebastian

timeline.bodyText: This catch can be removed.
timeline.author: schmidt-sebastian

timeline.bodyText: I think my comment earlier wasn't applicable... but it does seem that this is now a ReadFuture.

schmidt-sebastian

timeline.bodyText: This method seems unused.
timeline.author: schmidt-sebastian

timeline.bodyText: It took me a while to wade through all the callsites, but it seems like executorService is single-threaded and the is responsible for all access to outstandingGets. This means that markSent doesn't need to use an AtomicBoolean.
timeline.author: schmidt-sebastian

timeline.bodyText: This should only ever be hit when cancelled, or not?
timeline.author: schmidt-sebastian
schmidt-sebastian

timeline.bodyText: Can this be done in the OnCompletedListener?

timeline.bodyText: This is much easier than I thought it would be. Thanks for figuring this out.
timeline.author: schmidt-sebastian

This function should probably also have a short comment on what the return type is - or a more descriptive name.
